com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad

Class GamepadAxisState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.edinarobotics.utils.gamepad.GamepadAxisState

  • public class GamepadAxisState
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the state of all joystick axes of a Gamepad.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Vector2 left 
      private Vector2 right 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a new GamepadAxisState storing the given joystick states.

        public GamepadAxisState(Vector2 left,

        Constructs a new GamepadAxisState storing the given joystick states.
        Parameters:
        left - The state of the gamepad's left joystick as a Vector2.
        right - The state of the gamepad's right joystick as a Vector2.

      • getLeftDirection

        public double getLeftDirection()
        Returns the current direction of the Vector2 representing the state of the gamepad's left joystick in degrees (-180 to 180). This return value is suitable to be passed into RobotDrive. The angle calculation is in the format expected by WPILib. The angles are computed from the positive y-axis, positive angles run clockwise and negative angles run counterclockwise. This is not how angles are normally calculated.
        Returns:
        the current direction of the Vector2 representing the state of the gamepad's left joystick in degrees (-180 to 180).

      • getRightDirection

        public double getRightDirection()
        Returns the current direction of the Vector2 representing the state of the gamepad's right joystick in degrees (-180 to 180). This return value is suitable to be passed into RobotDrive. The angle calculation is in the format expected by WPILib. The angles are computed from the positive y-axis, positive angles run clockwise and negative angles run counterclockwise. This is not how angles are normally calculated.
        Returns:
        the current direction of the Vector2 representing the state of the gamepad's right joystick in degrees (-180 to 180).
